title: torch.load error on OSX  'module' object has no attribute '_rebuild_tensor'
body_html:
Hi,

I encounter the following error when I load the data using torch.load.

Traceback (most recent call last):
File "/Users/qzxie/workspace/openNMT/src/train_bucket.py", line 358, in main
dataset = torch.load(data)
File "/Users/qzxie/tools/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 222, in load
return _load(f, map_location, pickle_module)
File "/Users/qzxie/tools/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 370, in _load
result = unpickler.load()
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute '_rebuild_tensor'

I tried to load the same data on linux. It worked fine.

I think the error is due to a recent update of either torch.save or torch.load. The error appeared after I updated my pytorch yesterday.

body:
Hi, 

I encounter the following error when I load the data using torch.load.

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/qzxie/workspace/openNMT/src/train_bucket.py", line 358, in main
    dataset = torch.load(data)
  File "/Users/qzxie/tools/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 222, in load
    return _load(f, map_location, pickle_module)
  File "/Users/qzxie/tools/anaconda2/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/serialization.py", line 370, in _load
    result = unpickler.load()
AttributeError: 'module' object has no attribute '_rebuild_tensor'

I tried to load the same data on linux. It worked fine.

I think the error is due to a recent update of either torch.save or torch.load. The error appeared after I updated my pytorch yesterday.
